It took a while of prodding the Archmage's recollections of those times, and quite a bit of dusting off some old records besides, but we managed to dig up Azzar's name from the histories. Get this, he was one of Arthraime's top lieutenants! A young, promising, power-hungry mage with a talent for manipulation and persuation, he served as an effective recruiter for Arthraime's side during the war.

In any case, while my father is still technically the Mayor, I've stepped up to handling most of his duties here. I quite enjoy it actually! Maybe I should be the future Mayor, if only I can win over the City Council...

But despite our recent tragedies, we mustn't lose sight of what attracted the evil of Kheyn in the first place - together, allied with the Magi of Hydrobor, our city has soared! And I believe it will continue to do so; I believe one day our city will be the jewel of north, rivaling the likes of the Great Cities of Mellor and Traire!

And to think, had he not so brazenly attacked us here in Haywind, he would never have faced justice for his part in the war in Vhosphoran Kingdom all those decades ago.

option.optiontext: Right, the Sorcerer's War - remind me.
I've had the misfortune of dealing with other Vhosphoran magi in my adventures, ever heard of Gabrius and Eloria?
Very good, there's another thing on my mind.

node.text: Well, the old Master Traberius back in the wizard's tower is really the one to tell you about it - it all happened well before my time - but it was a war started by an evil wizard named Arthraime, who wanted to take the kingdom for himself. The Hydrobor Magi sided with the rightful Queen against his evil.

option.optiontext: Indeed, but there's something else I wanted to talk about.

node.text: Arthraime was eventually defeated, but the war proved long and bloody. In its aftermath, anti-magic sentiment rose within the kingdom, thus the common folk began referring to the war as the Sorcerer's War. Eventually the study of magic was outlawed and the Hydrobor Circle was forced into exile, so they migrated to the woodlands of Imberthale.

option.optiontext: Indeed, but there's something else I wanted to talk about.

node.text: After quite a bit of dusting off some old records, we learned Kheyn served as one of Arthraime's top lieutenants during the war, and towards its end, he evaded capture and disappeared for good. Until finally now, when he re-emerged in Haywind to wage war upon us again.

option.optiontext: I've had the misfortune of dealing with other Vhosphoran magi in my adventures, ever heard of Gabrius and Eloria?

node.text: Hmm, I'm not sure... was Eloria Mirvren not one of the famed Vhosphoran Nine - a circle of elite magi within the royal court? It was long since disbanded, of course, and I seem to recall most of them met their end one way or another... Gabrius, though, I can't say I'm familiar with.

option.optiontext: I believe he went by another name before - Gaberion Theraliss?
Let's talk about something else.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Brianna's face falls chalk white.*</color>\n\nNo, surely not... surely you jest? I think he's supposed to be dead, you must be mistaken! Granted, I do not know much about him, but even I've heard of his name...

He was supposed to be the greatest of the Vhosphoran Nine, he was the one who personally ended Desrin Arthraime... I'm not sure, but I think the war soured him somehow. I only know that he later took the life of the Hydrobor Archmage Eveniss Charandale, who'd before then been his good friend and ally. I hope he's gone!

option.optiontext: Remind me about the Sorcerer's War again.
That's a complicated story, but let's talk about something else.

node.text: May be my fighting days are behind me, but I can still ensure every capable warrior gets a sword in their hand.

node.text: Newcomer? You'll need a good cleaver to fell the monsters around here, before they fell you. Our smith makes what you need, but I'm the one to sell them to you. Smith don't talk much, you see.

option.optiontext: Let's see these cleavers.

node.text: Good choice!
Not everyone who chooses to live in these mountains is civilized like us folk here. Some nasty barbarian clans out there, poor smith got captured by one of them once...

Savages didn't like his words, so they took his tongue. Hard to know more specifics about that tale though - the smith can't easily tell us more. But one thing's for sure, you should buy one of his cleavers if you're planning to venture out there.

option.optiontext: Let's see these cleavers then.

node.text: Ever felt a barbed arrow rend your flesh, or an ogre's club break your bones? I do - I know all too well what it feels like, and what kind of protection you'll need against that. Your fancy iron plates won't protect you here.

option.optiontext: Let's see what you're offering.
Had enough of bodily punishment and decided to set up shop?

node.text: It is a wise man who seeks protection from my shop.

I do not spin simple tales to sell my wares! I lived among the barbarian clans once. I was already a trader among them, but they found me too soft... especially after I started trading with the townsfolk.

I was shunned and exiled. But goodbyes among the barbarian clans are never a cordial affair. It was a miracle I ever managed to walk out alive. I stay away from them now, and can only offer warning to the occasional adventurers who stray their way. I can also improve their chances by selling armor that may keep them alive.

option.optiontext: Let's see what you're offering.
Maybe we'll trade another time.

node.text: Never should have come here...

option.optiontext: What's so bad here?

node.text: Oh nothing, nevermind the ogres and criminal brutes looking to slaughter you the moment you go out there. No, it's the weather! Nothing but grey, overcast skies, snowfall and slippery mountain stones! During winter there's no light at all! I feel dead inside!

option.optiontext: Uh... so why don't you leave?
Look, I'm just here to trade...
I'll leave you to it.

node.text: Well, maybe I will! I'll just need to earn some coin for my travels. So... care to buy anything, sir?

option.optiontext: Fine, let's see what you have.

node.text: For many eyes these mountains appear crude and barren, but powerful flora grows here, make no mistake. Perhaps precisely because it is such a challenging environment, the mountain plants develop powerful alchemical properties. Well, at least I'd like to think so.

option.optiontext: Got any powerful potions to sell?
Plants are the subject of your study, I take it?

node.text: I suppose power is always relative, my friend... but I've yet to see potions from elsewhere in these lands that would match the potency of my own.

Dare I call myself a scholar, hmm? It was not always so... You see, I am among some of the eldest left in this village now. Once upon a time I was a proud young warrior, to whom a sharp blade and the strength of arm was most valuable. Alas, over time my strength wained, and I watched my friends fall victim to diseases and poisons. I slowly began to appreciate different powers that nature had to offer.

option.optiontext: Have those powers produced any powerful potions?
Maybe another time.

node.text: How lovely to see a fresh new face around these parts. Try not to get yourself killed too quickly out there, that'd be no fun. Happens more often than you'd like to think... Anyway, you're here more for magical items and less for my charming company, I presume?

option.optiontext: That's a correct assessment.
Why's the store called 'Archaeological Magics'?

node.text: Just the other day I sourced what I thought was a real dragon's egg, but turned out it was just a curiously shaped stone...

Oh well, you see, not only am I a trained mage from the Mellorian high society, but I'm also something of an enthusiast when it comes to ancient history and magical ruins. So my plan was I'd come to these lands to source magical artifacts from the depths of such untouched ruins.

option.optiontext: Found any ruins up on these mountains?
Let's see the magical items then.
Fascinating, but I should go.

node.text: Ahm, well... no. That's not to say there aren't any, I'm sure the ''ancient magical civilization'' left such structures all over the place. But they're probably buried beneath the stone now. I suppose that leaves my items a bit lacking in the archaeological department, doesn't it? But I assure you they're all the more magical!
